subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h2" subtitle_font_options="tag:div"]A Backward Fed Has Led to a Backward Bull[/dfd_heading][vc_column_text]In this talk, learn why the bull market is not ending, but just getting started!  Find out why bond yields will decline more than what most investors are expecting, which will supercharge this bull.  Finally, find out why the U.S. economy will not experience a recession, but rather a soft landing.  Don't miss Jim Paulsen's talk.  He has come out of retirement and ready to share his insights on what to expect from the markets and the economy![/vc_column_text][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]
Attend this talk and learn...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" list_fields="%5B%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Fed%20actions%20have%20resulted%20in%20a%20Fed-Induced%20Bull%20Market%20Restart%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Bond%20Yields%20to%20decline%20much%20more%20than%20expected%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Lack%20of%20Private%20sector%20vulnerabilities%20keeps%20a%20Recession%20at%20bay%22%7D%5D" icon_border="border_style:none|border_color:%2334d288" main_style="style-1" icon_size="20" icon_color="#5e67bb" font_options="tag:h6|color:%2334d288"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]James Paulsen is a PhD trained economist. Jim has been an investment industry professional since 1983. He recently retired as chief investment strategist for the Leuthold group, and prior to that he served as chief investment strategist at Wells Capital Management where he worked for 20 years. He is an avid speaker and writer on the economy and the markets and frequently appears on CNBC and Bloomberg TV. He earned a bachelor’s degree and a doctoral degree in economics from Iowa State University. His current thinking on the economy and the markets can be found at Paulsenperspectives.Substack.com[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h2" subtitle_font_options="tag:div"]Ten Years Later:  Shareholder Yield:  A Better Approach to Dividend Investing[/dfd_heading][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Join Meb Faber, Cambria’s Chief Investment Officer, as he discusses the importance of a holistic income strategy.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]
Attend this talk and learn...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" list_fields="%5B%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Dividend%20and%20buyback%20strategy%20considerations%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Today%E2%80%99s%20market%20environment%2C%20historical%20performance%2C%20and%20risk%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Key%20differences%20between%20US%20and%20foreign%20stock%20markets.%22%7D%5D" icon_border="border_style:none|border_color:%2334d288" main_style="style-1" icon_size="20" icon_color="#5e67bb" font_options="tag:h6|color:%2334d288"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]Mebane Faber is the author of several books, including "The Ivy Portfolio" with Eric Richardson (Wiley, 2009), “Global Asset Allocation” (2015) and, most recently, "Invest With the House" (2016). He writes the MebFaber.com blog and The Idea Farm newsletter, and he has been featured in The New York Times, Barron’s, The New Yorker and dozens of other forums. As chief investment officer of Cambria Investment Management, he runs Cambria’s exchange-traded funds (ETFs), separate accounts and hedge funds. He graduated from the University of Virginia with a double major in engineering science and biology.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_separator color="blue"][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Financial Education meeting information that focuses on the broad overview of basic individual investing in today's market.
